Class ArrayUtilities

  • java.lang.Object

extends java.lang.Object

    • Method Detail

      • scaleArray

        public static double[] scaleArray(double[] orig,
                                  double ratio)
        Scale every element of the input primitive array by an element-wise division operation with the scalar input.
        i.e. for each element i of orig, divide by ratio (i/ratio). Note: No other classes use this method yet
        Parameters:
        orig - primitive array to element-wise divide
        ratio - denominator for each array value
        Returns:
        the new scalar array of each orig divided by ratio

      • reverseArray

        public static double[] reverseArray(double[] orig)
        Reverse the order of an input primitive array.
        Parameters:
        orig - the array to reverse
        Returns:
        reversed array, null if orig array is null
        See Also:
        PileupExtract

      • windowSmooth

        public static double[] windowSmooth(double[] orig,
                                    int win)
        Apply a smoothing window to an input primitive array.
        Parameters:
        orig - the array to smooth
        win - the size of the smoothing window (recommend odd values for symmetrical smoothing but not required)
        Returns:
        the smoothed window
        See Also:
        TagPileup

      • gaussSmooth

        public static double[] gaussSmooth(double[] orig,
                                   int size,
                                   int num)
        Apply a gaussian smoothing to an input primitive array.
        Parameters:
        orig - the array to smooth
        size - set the size of the standard deviation
        num - set the number of standard deviations
        Returns:
        the smoothed window

      • getPositionalVariance

        public static double getPositionalVariance(double[] array)
        Return the positional variance of an input primitive array.
        Parameters:
        array - the input array to calculate from
        Returns:
        positional variance of array (NaN if array is empty and 0 if array has only 1 element)
        See Also:
        AggregateData
